data.name: The Line
data.description:
WINNER - 2020 Primetime Emmy® Award for Outstanding Innovation in Interactive Media.
WINNER - Best VR Experience at 76th Venice International Film Festival.
“The Line” is a 15-20 minute interactive story about love and fear of change, allowing you to unlock an enchanted miniature model of two miniature dolls, Pedro and Rosa.
Set within a scale model of 1940s São Paulo, this experience invites you to pull on knobs and even crawl under the machinery to unfold the story of these figurines who are perfect for each other but reluctant to live out their love. 
 
"The Line" is great to showcase VR for first-time users. 
 
Narrated by Rodrigo Santoro and directed by Ricardo Laganaro.
 
Room-scale and seated mode: Move around the scale model, or experience the story around you for those with limited space or reduced mobility. Narration in English, Portuguese, Korean, and simplified Chinese. SDH Subtitles in English, Portuguese, Korean, Japanese, French, Spanish, German, and simplified Chinese.

changelog.change_log:
- Quest 2 frame rate and resolution optimizations: Game now runs at 90fps and 1.3x native resolution on this device.
- Game now uses “High-Frequency Hand Tracking” mode on Quest 2, increasing tracking rate to 60hz
- Included narration in Simplified Chinese

- Included full-text localization and SDH subtitles in Korean, Japanese, French, Spanish and German
- Included narration in Korean
- Fixed minor bugs
- Quality of life updates

Added anonymized user analytics with opt-out option.
Minor bug fixes and improvements.
